channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Palestinian activist was killed by the violence he sought to stop
item.description: Awdah Al Hathaleen was shot during a clash with an Israeli settler. His West Bank village hoped No Other Land, the Oscar-winning film about settler vi...

item.title: U.S. and China extend tariff truce deadline for another 3 months
item.description: President Trump's executive order extends a reprieve from the threat of rising tariffs between the world's two largest economies.

item.title: Trump's Washington, D.C. takeover targets a host of groups, many of them vulnerable
item.description: Some residents are skeptical President Trump's use of tough police tactics will work to solve complex social ills.

item.title: Say bye-bye to the beeps and boops of AOL's dial-up internet service
item.description: AOL debuted the service in 1991. Dial-up has largely been replaced by broadband internet.

item.title: Alaska was once a full-fledged Russian colony. Now it's hosting a U.S.-Russia summit
item.description: Russia lost a war in Crimea in the 1850s. To pay off war debts, Russia sold Alaska to the U.S. Now presidents Trump and Putin will meet Friday in Alas...

item.title: Charges dropped against teen pilot detained in Antarctica
item.description: Ethan Guo must leave the island and pay $30,000 dollars to charity for illegally landing on Chilean territory, a judge says.

item.title: Ukraine's borders must not be changed by force, EU leaders say
item.description: The EU says "the people of Ukraine must have the freedom to decide their future."

item.title: Grammy-winning Afropop star Tems: 'Women are not respected in the industry'
item.description: The Nigerian musician details her rise to the top of a notoriously male-dominated industry.

item.title: Officials are still investigating the cause of a Pennsylvania steel plant explosion that killed 2
item.description: Officials are still working to determine the cause of an explosion that rocked a steel plant outside Pittsburgh, leaving two dead and 10 injured.

item.title: Cops bust "spiritual retreat" offering frog venom, hallucinogenic drugs
item.description: Officers seized 11 liters of ayahuasca, 117 San Pedro cactus plants and several bottles of frog venom known as Kambo.

item.title: Man faces jail in US for shipping 850 turtles in socks to Hong Kong
item.description: The turtles were packed in boxes labelled as plastic toys, according to the Justice Department.

item.title: Shohei Ohtani, agent sued over $240 million Hawaii real estate project
item.description: A Hawaii real estate investor and broker are suing Shohei Ohtani, claiming the L.A. Dodgers superstar and his agent got them fired from a $240 million...

item.title: "Glacial outburst" flooding threat prompts disaster declaration in Alaska
item.description: Alaska Gov. Mike Dunleavy declared a state disaster due to what he called the "imminent threat of catastrophic flooding from a glacier lake outburst f...

item.title: Trump names new BLS head after firing old commissioner amid weak jobs report
item.description: President Trump announced E.J. Antoni as his nominee to lead the Bureau of Labor Statistics on Monday, after he fired the former commissioner and blam...

item.title: General testifies he didn't hear L.A. protests described as "rebellion"
item.description: Three officials involved in President Trump's controversial L.A. National Guard deployment testified in court Monday.

item.title: Scores still missing a week after India flash floods
item.description: Rescue operations at the disaster site have been hampered by heavy rains and blocked roads.

item.title: Shooter kills 3 in a Target parking lot in Austin, Texas, before being captured, police say
Trial starts over Trump administrationâ€™s deployment of National Guard to Los Angeles
